Young, # 3 Exhibit A, # 4 Exhibit B, # 5 Exhibit C, # 6 Exhibit D, # 7 Exhibit E, # 8 Exhibit F, # 9 Text of Proposed Order)(Young, Sean) (Entered: 07/23/2019)
recap_documents.short_description: Brief in Support of Pls.' Mot. for Prelin. Inj.

recap_documents.description: ORDER: The Court finds that Plaintiffs are entitled to judgment as a matter of law on Counts I and II of their 1 Verified Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief. Plaintiffs' 124 Motion for Summary Judgment is GRANTED. The State Defendants' 125 Motion for Summary Judgment and/or Partial Summary Judgment is DENIED. The Court thus declares the rights of the parties as follows: Sections 3 and 4 of H.B. 481 violate the Fourteenth Amendment of the United States Constitution. The Court ORDERS that all Defendants, and all their respective officers, successors in office, agents, servants, employees, attorneys, and persons acting in concert or participation with them, are PERMANENTLY ENJOINED from enforcing H.B. 481 (Georgia General Assembly 2019-20 Legislative Session) in its entirety. As a result, the State of Georgia's abortion laws that were in effect prior to the passage of H.B. 481 remain in effect. As there are no further issues outstanding, the Clerk is DIRECTED to enter judgment in favor of Plaintiffs and CLOSE THIS CASE. Signed by Judge Steve C. Jones on 7/13/2020. (rjs) (Entered: 07/13/2020)

caseName: Haynes v. Attorney General of New York
cause: 28:2254 Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus (State)

recap_documents.description: MEMORANDUM DECISION, Haynes has failed to show a basis for relief under 28 U.S.C. § 2254. Accordingly, his habeas petition is denied. Additionally, I decline to issue a  certificate of appealability because Haynes has not made a substantial show ing of the denial  of a constitutional right. See 28 U.S.C. § 2253. Pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1915(a)(3), I certify that any appeal taken from this decision and order would not be taken in good faith. The Clerk of the Court shall enter judgme nt accordingly and close this case. The Clerk shall also mail copies of this memorandum decision and the judgment to Haynes at his last known address. So Ordered by Circuit Judge VJ-Denny Chin on 2/15/2023.(fwd'd for jgm) (c/m to    Marcell Haynes, 16-A-3060, Eastern NY Correctional Facility, P.O. Box 338, Napanoch, NY 12458-0338)  (TL)
